data.title: Ben Harris - 2024 - Football
data.meta_description: Ben Harris (7) Quarterback  - UNA 2023: Played in two games in 2023 ... Completed two of four passes for 18 yards in games against Tarleton State and Florida State

Biography

UNA 2023: Played in two games in 2023 ... Completed two of four passes for 18 yards in games against Tarleton State and Florida State ... Threw an 11-yard pass against No. 4 Florida State ... Also had an eight-yard rush ... Had two passes for 61 yards and a touchdown in the UNA "Purple vs. White" Spring Game on March 21, 2024 while also catching a touchdown on a trick play.

UNA 2022: Played in three games in 2022 … Completed one of three passes for six total yards … Rushed three times for 31 yards with an average of 10.3 yards per carry and a long of 15 yards.

PRIOR TO UNA: A member of the football team at the University of Oklahoma under head coach Lincoln Riley in 2021 where the team won the Alamo Bowl … He was a preferred walk-on at OU.

HIGH SCHOOL: Played quarterback at Carl Albert High School under head coach Michael Corley … Led the Titans to a 52-2 record and four Class 5A State Championships in his time in the program … His 52 wins as a starter are more than any other player in the history of football in the state of Oklahoma ... He is also the only starting quarterback in Oklahoma high school history to lead his team to four consecutive state championships ... Titans won 40 consecutive games at one stretch ... Earned OCA All-State honors and was District 5A-2 Most Valuable Player … Broke high school records for passing yards and touchdowns … Completed 613 of 961 career passes for 9.443 yards and 93 touchdowns ... He completed 64 percent of his passes and only threw 20 career interceptions ... Averaged 15 yards per completion ... As a senior, Harris completed 67.3 percent of his passes (169-of-251) for 2,215 yards with 22 touchdowns and seven interceptions … He also ran for 571 yards and five TDs … Harris put up solid numbers at Carl Albert beginning in his freshman season … In 2017, he threw for 2,766 yards and 35 touchdowns (four interceptions), in 2018 he threw for 2,361 yards and 20 TDs (six INTs), and in 2019 he threw for 2,101 yards and 16 TDs (three INTs)…He also punted three years for the Titans … Lettered in baseball and basketball.

PERSONAL: Full name is Benjamin Bradley Harris … Son of John Harris and Kristy Carr and has one sister … Major is Psychology.
